thread.title: ESPN's College GameDay crew predicts Saturday's winners
thread.title_full: ESPN's College GameDay crew predicts Saturday's winners

title: ESPN's College GameDay crew predicts Saturday's winners
text:
ESPN's College GameDay crew predicts Saturday's winners The picks are in for ESPN's panel of College GameDay experts. Slot to 247Sports Links 
ESPN's Jay Bilas, Jay Williams and Seth Greenberg have weighed in on Saturday's top college basketball games. 
Here's what the College GameDay analysts said during Saturday's broadcast, live from St. Mary's, where the Gaels battle unbeaten and top-ranked Gonzaga: 
Buick Saturday Selections 
Highest ranked team will lose? 
Williams: Florida State going down to Notre Dame. 
Greenberg: Oregon playing back to back USC, UCLA. Very talented USC team. 
Bilas: At Notre Dame vs. Florida State is toughest game all day long. FSU is better, but Notre Dame is tough. 
Who will win Gonzaga-St. Mary's? 
Greenberg: Pace of the game is key and St. Mary's can't control the tempo of the game. 
Williams: Very similar to Kentucky-Kansas game, I had to phone a friend. I feel like it could be St. Mary's time, but Gonzaga is going undefeated. I'm sorry. 
Saturday's top games 
Texas A&M at Florida, Noon EST, ESPN2 
Kansas State at West Virginia, Noon EST, ESPN 
Kentucky at Alabama, 1 p.m. EST, CBS 
Clemson at Duke, 1 p.m. EST, ACC Network 
Miami at Louisville, 2 p.m. EST, ESPN2 
Kansas at Texas Tech, 2 p.m. EST, ESPN 
TCU at Baylor, 2 p.m. EST, ESPNU 
Villanova at Xavier, 2:30 p.m. EST, FOX 
Ohio State at Maryland, 4 p.m. EST, ESPN 
Gonzaga at St. Mary's, 8:15 p.m. EST, ESPN Author
